title: Establishes penalties for failure to provide a DNA sample and failure to register or verify as a sex offender
summary: Establishes penalties for failure to provide a DNA sample and failure to register or verify as a sex offender; establishes the crimes of failure to provide a DNA sample in the first and second degree and failure to register or verify as a sex offender in the first and second degree.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                        262--A

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  PAULIN, TITONE, ZEBROWSKI, GALEF, GABRYSZAK,
         JAFFEE, LANCMAN, MAISEL, P. RIVERA -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M.  of  A.
         BOYLAND,  DESTITO,  GUNTHER, LENTOL, PHEFFER, SWEENEY -- read once and
         referred to the Committee  on  Codes  --  committee  discharged,  bill
         amended,  ordered reprinted as amended and recommitted to said commit-
         tee

       AN ACT to amend the penal law and the correction  law,  in  relation  to
         establishing penalties for failure to provide a DNA sample and failure
         to register or verify as a sex offender

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The penal law is amended by adding two new sections  195.01
    2  and 195.02 to read as follows:
    3  S 195.01 FAILURE TO PROVIDE A DNA SAMPLE IN THE SECOND DEGREE.
    4    A  PERSON  IS  GUILTY OF FAILURE TO PROVIDE A DNA SAMPLE IN THE SECOND
    5  DEGREE WHEN, BEING A DESIGNATED OFFENDER  WHO  HAS  BEEN  CONVICTED  AND
    6  SENTENCED  FOR  A  CRIME  SPECIFIED IN SUBDIVISION SEVEN OF SECTION NINE
    7  HUNDRED NINETY-FIVE OF THE EXECUTIVE LAW AND HAVING  BEEN  GIVEN  NOTICE
    8  THAT HE OR SHE IS REQUIRED TO PROVIDE A SAMPLE APPROPRIATE FOR DNA TEST-
    9  ING  PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION THREE OF SECTION NINE HUNDRED NINETY-FIVE-C
   10  OF THE EXECUTIVE LAW, SUCH PERSON REFUSES, RESISTS OR OTHERWISE FAILS TO
   11  PROVIDE SUCH SAMPLE.
   12    FAILURE TO PROVIDE A DNA SAMPLE IN THE SECOND  DEGREE  IS  A  CLASS  A
   13  MISDEMEANOR.
   14  S 195.02 FAILURE TO PROVIDE A DNA SAMPLE IN THE FIRST DEGREE.
   15    A  PERSON  IS  GUILTY  OF FAILURE TO PROVIDE A DNA SAMPLE IN THE FIRST
   16  DEGREE WHEN HE OR SHE COMMITS THE CRIME OF  FAILURE  TO  PROVIDE  A  DNA
   17  SAMPLE IN THE SECOND DEGREE AND HAS PREVIOUSLY BEEN CONVICTED OF FAILURE
   18  TO PROVIDE A DNA SAMPLE IN THE SECOND DEGREE.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00826-02-1

       A. 262--A                           2

    1    FAILURE TO PROVIDE A DNA SAMPLE IN THE FIRST DEGREE IS A CLASS E FELO-
    2  NY.
    3    S  2.  The  penal law is amended by adding two new sections 195.03 and
    4  195.04 to read as follows:
    5  S 195.03 FAILURE TO REGISTER OR VERIFY AS A SEX OFFENDER IN  THE  SECOND
    6             DEGREE.
    7    A  PERSON IS GUILTY OF FAILURE TO REGISTER OR VERIFY AS A SEX OFFENDER
    8  IN THE SECOND DEGREE WHEN, BEING A SEX OFFENDER REQUIRED TO REGISTER  OR
    9  VERIFY  PURSUANT TO ARTICLE SIX-C OF THE CORRECTION LAW, HE OR SHE FAILS
   10  TO REGISTER OR VERIFY IN THE MANNER AND WITHIN THE TIME PERIODS PROVIDED
   11  FOR IN SUCH ARTICLE.
   12    FAILURE TO REGISTER OR VERIFY AS A SEX OFFENDER IN THE  SECOND  DEGREE
   13  IS A CLASS E FELONY.
   14  S  195.04  FAILURE  TO REGISTER OR VERIFY AS A SEX OFFENDER IN THE FIRST
   15             DEGREE.
   16    A PERSON IS GUILTY OF FAILURE TO REGISTER OR VERIFY AS A SEX  OFFENDER
   17  IN  THE  FIRST  DEGREE  WHEN  HE  OR SHE COMMITS THE CRIME OF FAILURE TO
   18  REGISTER OR VERIFY AS A SEX OFFENDER IN THE SECOND DEGREE AND HAS PREVI-
   19  OUSLY BEEN CONVICTED OF FAILURE TO REGISTER OR VERIFY AS A SEX  OFFENDER
   20  IN  THE  SECOND  DEGREE  AS DEFINED IN SECTION 195.03 OF THIS ARTICLE OR
   21  CONVICTED FOR FAILURE TO REGISTER OR VERIFY UNDER  SECTION  ONE  HUNDRED
   22  SIXTY-EIGHT-T  OF  THE CORRECTION LAW AS IT EXISTED IMMEDIATELY PRIOR TO
   23  THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THE CHAPTER OF THE LAWS  OF  TWO  THOUSAND  ELEVEN
   24  WHICH ADDED THIS SECTION.
   25    FAILURE TO REGISTER OR VERIFY AS A SEX OFFENDER IN THE FIRST DEGREE IS
   26  A CLASS D FELONY.
   27    S 3. Section 168-t of the correction law, as amended by chapter 373 of
   28  the laws of 2007, is amended to read as follows:
   29    S 168-t. [Penalty] VIOLATIONS; ADDITIONAL PENALTIES.
   30    [Any  sex  offender  required to register or to verify pursuant to the
   31  provisions of this article who fails to register or verify in the manner
   32  and within the time periods provided for in this article shall be guilty
   33  of a class E felony upon conviction for  the  first  offense,  and  upon
   34  conviction for a second or subsequent offense shall be guilty of a class
   35  D  felony.]  Any sex offender who violates the provisions of section one
   36  hundred sixty-eight-v of this article shall  be  guilty  of  a  class  A
   37  misdemeanor  upon  conviction for the first offense, and upon conviction
   38  for a second or subsequent offense shall be guilty of a class D  felony.
   39  [Any such] IN ADDITION TO ANY OTHER PENALTIES PROVIDED BY LAW, ANY fail-
   40  ure to register or verify may also be the basis for revocation of parole
   41  pursuant to section two hundred fifty-nine-i of the executive law or the
   42  basis  for  revocation of probation pursuant to article four hundred ten
   43  of the criminal procedure law.
   44    S 4. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   45  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law and the correction law, in relation to establishing penalties for failure to provide a DNA sample and failure to register or verify as a sex offender
